article_node.title: Hong Kong lawmakers urge more teacher training to spot serious child abuse cases
article_node.summary: Hong Kong lawmakers and educators are advocating for increased training for teachers to better identify serious child abuse cases, following updated guidelines that require mandatory reporting of suspected incidents starting January next year. The new policy, outlined in an Education Bureau circular, mandates that educators and related professionals report any suspicions of serious harm to children, with failure to do so resulting in criminal charges. Concerns have been raised about the challenges school staff face in assessing abuse severity, highlighting the need for proper training.
